Header: WHO warns there may be no vaccine option for new Ebola outbreak
Content: The World Health Organization confirmed four people have tested positive for Ebola in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo just days after another outbreak that killed 33 people in the northwest was declared over and warned it may be impossible to use a vaccine to tackle it. Twenty people have already died from haemorrhagic fevers in and around Mangina, a densely populated town about 30 km southwest of the city of Beni and 100 km from the Ugandan border. Four cases have been confirmed which include two health workers.
